Description: The rest on the flight into Egypt; the Virgin seen seated in a field holding the Christ Child; a basket and a bundle seen next to her; a donkey chewing grass seen behind to left and men working on fields to right. Engraving
Bibliographic references: Hollstein / Dutch and Flemish etchings, engravings and woodcuts c.1450-1700 (478.I) (Wierix)
Mauquoy-Hendrickx 1979 / Les Estampes des Wierix ... catalogue raisonné (264)
Alvin 1866 / Catalogue raisonné de l'oeuvre des trois frères Jan, Jérome et Antoine Wierix (171)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: A E Evans & Sons
Acquisition notes: The Bill Book contains an entry on 28 October 1858 for '2 vols containing 270 prints by Wierix in beautiful condition', purchased from Messrs Evans for £42. These volumes were broken up at the time, and integrated with '21 prints by the Wierix' listed on 28 January 1859. The total of 291 prints more or less matches the run registered as 1859,0709.2939 to 3232 (294 prints). But it is not yet possible to say exactly which came from the 2 albums, or anything about the albums themselves which must have been a more or less contemporary collection of the brothers' work. They may be traceable in a London auction of the period.
